jobs.title: Front-End Developer and Graphic Designer
jobs.about_us: Join a growing web development company that creates custom websites for insurance professionals across the U.S. The team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence. You’ll work directly with the founders and gain specialized experience in insurance technology while making an immediate impact.
jobs.job_description:
Our client is looking for a Front-End Developer with strong graphic design skills to build visually engaging, user-friendly websites and marketing materials. This role focuses on front-end development, design, and client support, giving you the opportunity to directly impact the online presence of insurance agents nationwide.

Responsibilities
- Design and develop responsive, user-friendly website interfaces
- Create custom layouts, graphics, and visual assets for websites and marketing materials
- Customize WordPress themes (front-end focus) to meet client branding and functionality needs
- Ensure cross-browser compatibility, performance optimization, and mobile responsiveness
- Collaborate with the founding team on design concepts, UX improvements, and brand consistency
- Provide technical and design support to clients, helping them effectively manage and use their websites
- Implement website updates, modifications, and enhancements as requested
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- 4+ years of professional front-end development experience
- Strong graphic design skills (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, or similar)
- Expertise with WordPress front-end customization (themes, page builders, styling)
- Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript (front-end technologies)
- Experience with responsive and mobile-first design
- Excellent English communication skills for client interaction
- Ability to work on Mac systems
- Strong attention to detail and confidentiality

jobs.title: Front-End UI/UX Developer (ZR_18746_JOB)
jobs.job_description:
Responsibilities:
UI/UX Design : Build visually appealing and user-friendly app interfaces.
Responsive Design : Make the app work well on all devices and screen sizes.
Code Writing : Write clean and efficient code to turn designs into functional features.
Testing and Fixing : Identify and fix UI issues to ensure smooth and bug-free operation.
Performance Boosting : Improve app speed and scalability while keeping the design intact.
Consistency : Follow design systems or help create a consistent style for the app.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
Experience:
Proven experience in UI/UX development with a portfolio showcasing a strong understanding of design principles and responsive design.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern UI frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
Familiarity with UI design tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD.
Responsive Design Knowledge:
Strong understanding of responsive web design techniques and the ability to create apps optimized for various devices and screen sizes.
Coding Best Practices:
Knowledge of clean, maintainable, and efficient code writing, with experience in version control tools such as Git.
Problem-Solving:
Ability to troubleshoot and debug UI/UX issues, with attention to detail and a focus on providing optimal solutions.
Performance Optimization:
Experience in optimizing app performance for speed and scalability, ensuring a smooth user experience.
Design Systems:
Familiarity with design systems and the ability to adhere to or help create consistent design guidelines.
Collaboration and Communication:
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Education:
A degree in Computer Science, Web Design, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

jobs.title: Intern - Front End Developer
jobs.about_us: As the world moves even more online due to the coronavirus pandemic, customers are connected and empowered like never before. Customers want an immediate, personalized and consistent experience, no matter which channel they choose to engage with a brand. Sprinklr helps brands meet the demands of today’s customers by providing them with the insights they need to make every interaction matter. Sprinklr is a Customer Experience Management (CXM) platform for modern enterprises with 2500+ employees helping the world’s most valuable enterprises make their customers happier. Learn more about our culture and how we make our employees happier through The Sprinklr Way.
jobs.job_description:
Sprinklr is looking for Interns who have strong competencies in data structures and algorithms. So, if you desire to work on interesting projects which focus on code solutions that involve research and interactivity, Sprinklr is the best workplace to be in.

What Will You Do
- You will be part of a fast-paced young team, your experience will matter the most and should be genuine and in-depth in subjects you’ve worked on
- Breathe programming!
- The role calls for strong programmers who work on emerging business requirements
- Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to our technology, algorithms, and products
- Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results on schedule
- Build reusable code and libraries for future use
- Tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies
jobs.job_requirements:
What Makes You Qualified
- Ability to work both independently and in cooperation with others
- A sense of urgency and ownership over the product
- Thrives in open or ambiguous environments
- Great demeanour towards work and people
- Intellectually curious and inventive

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.about_us: Join a forward-thinking insurtech company dedicated to redefining how insurance is bought, managed, and experienced. We're building digital-first, customer-centric platforms that deliver transparency, empowerment, and innovation to our policyholders.
jobs.job_description:
We’re looking for a talented Front-End Developer to bring beautifully designed user interfaces to life—especially those integral to insurance workflows such as quote generation, claims management, and policy comparisons. You’ll translate UI/UX designs into high-quality code, ensuring seamless, accessible, and performant user experiences tailored to the strict compliance and clarity demands of the insurance industry.

Job Highlights
Hourly Rate: USD 7.79, the equivalent in your local currency
Paid Hours per Week: 40
Schedule: Fixed Schedule (NY)
Work Arrangement: Work from home
Contract: Independent Contractor
Side note: Since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an “Independent Contractor” arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.

Key Responsibilities
- Craft responsive, insurance-specific interfaces such as quote calculators, dashboards, and forms, using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript frameworks.
- Translate UI/UX designs into production-ready front-end code, working closely with UX/design and back-end teams.
- Ensure performance, usability, and responsiveness across web and mobile platforms.
- Implement robust input validation and insurance-specific compliance checks, ensuring accuracy during processes like quoting and claims submission.
- Write clean, maintainable code with accompanying unit and acceptance tests, and participate in code reviews to ensure reliability and reduce regressions.
- Refactor and optimize front-end code to enhance scalability and maintainability, especially relevant for complex forms and dynamic components.
- Stay informed on emerging front-end technologies and regulatory trends affecting insurance UX, such as accessibility standards and data security.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- 3–5+ years of front-end development experience, with at least 2 years working on insurance or financial services applications.
- Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, with experience in frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
- Strong experience in front-end build tools, such as Webpack, npm/yarn, and deployment systems.
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs integration and version control systems like Git.
- Exceptional attention to detail, especially in UX flows, input forms, and compliance-related UI logic.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills —you’ll work closely with cross-functional teams and adapt fast to changes.

Nice-to-Have
- Understanding of insurance domain concepts, such as underwriting logic, risk calculations, claims workflows, or regulatory guidelines.
- Experience with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG), ensuring inclusive user access.
- Familiarity with TypeScript or testing frameworks like Jest or Cypress.

jobs.title: Frontend/Backend Developer - Vue.js/Nuxt (ZR_22168_JOB)
jobs.about_us: Join a forward-thinking fintech company revolutionizing digital payment infrastructure and financial services across global markets.
jobs.job_description:
As a Frontend/Backend Developer, you’ll work at the intersection of user experience and technical performance — building fast, secure, and scalable web applications that empower users to manage, send, and receive funds with confidence. You will be part of the founding technical team, helping to lay the groundwork for a robust and extensible development ecosystem. This is an ideal role for someone passionate about fintech innovation, who thrives in a high-trust, high-performance environment with real opportunities to grow into broader technical or leadership roles.

Key Responsibilities

Web Platform & Landing Page Development
- Build and maintain responsive, high-performing marketing sites and user-facing applications using Vue.js and Nuxt with clean code and reusable components.

Code Quality & Testing
- Deliver production-ready code that is readable, scalable, and testable. Emphasis on writing clean code that minimizes QA overhead and supports fast iteration.

Agile Collaboration
- Work within a lean, agile development cycle, contributing to sprint planning, estimates, and peer reviews. Collaborate across product, design, and backend teams to deliver cohesive solutions.

Project Ownership
- Participate in self-organized planning, proactively manage timelines, and take initiative in shaping technical priorities.

Core Platform Contributions
- Engage in continuous improvement of internal tools, developer workflows, and platform architecture as part of the foundational engineering team.
jobs.job_requirements:
Technical Skills
- Proficient in Vue.js and Nuxt (including SSR, routing, and store management)
- Strong understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript (ES6+)
- Experience integrating REST APIs or GraphQL endpoints
- Familiarity with Git version control and modern build tools

Soft Skills
- Excellent English communication skills
- Strong attention to detail and UX sensibility
- Self-directed and organized with excellent time and task management skills

Nice to Have (but not required)
- Exposure to backend frameworks or willingness to expand into full-stack development
- Experience with security best practices (important in fintech)
- Prior work in a regulated or high-compliance environment (finance, healthcare, etc.)
- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and Docker workflows

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.about_us: Join an innovative AI healthcare startup that’s revolutionizing how chronic condition patients navigate the complex US healthcare system. This cutting-edge company combines artificial intelligence with patient care services to create meaningful impact in healthcare delivery. As a lean, fast-moving organization, they’re disrupting traditional healthcare navigation by leveraging AI agents and advanced technologies to quarterback patient needs. The company operates with a strategic focus on high-margin AI products while building a world-class international team.
jobs.job_description:
You’ll be at the forefront of healthcare innovation, building sophisticated frontend applications that power AI-driven patient navigation solutions. This role offers the exciting opportunity to work with the latest AI tools and APIs while creating user experiences that directly impact patient care and outcomes. You’ll be part of a core development team building next-generation healthcare technology that helps chronic condition patients navigate complex medical systems with AI-enhanced support.

Job Highlights
Hourly Rate: USD 15.58, the equivalent in your local currency
Paid Hours per Week: 40
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8 AM to 5 PM, Eastern Time (Boston)
Work Arrangement: Work from home
Contract: Independent Contractor
Side note: Since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an “Independent Contractor” arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Extensive experience with AI tools and AI APIs (prioritized over traditional years of experience)
- Healthcare industry experience with deep understanding of HIPAA compliance and encryption standards
- Proficiency in modern frontend development frameworks and cutting-edge technologies
- Strong English communication skills for collaboration with US-based team
- Ability to work independently with flexible scheduling in a remote environment
- Passion for healthcare innovation and improving patient outcomes through technology

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.about_us: A fast-growing, nationally recognized organization is seeking an experienced Front End Developer with expertise in the Vue framework.
jobs.job_description:
The ideal candidate will be proactive, highly skilled in building web-based, interactive tools, and comfortable working with significant amounts of data. You’ll play a critical role in the continued development of custom internal tools used for managing requests for quote (RFQs) and other operational functions. As the software development team continues to expand, future leadership opportunities may be available for high-performing team members.

Key Responsibilities
- Write clean, maintainable code following best practices and industry standards.
- Maintain and update the current codebase, ensuring scalability and performance.
- Help migrate existing code to the latest versions of Vue and related technologies.
- Test and implement new features with stakeholders, monitoring rollouts to ensure optimal functionality.
- Investigate, design, and implement new technologies to enhance system performance.
- Collaborate with the software development team and cross-functional stakeholders to deliver effective solutions.
- Develop efficient database queries and assist in maintaining a PostgreSQL database.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
- 5+ years of professional software development experience, including design, implementation, testing, build, and release.
- Proven experience as a Vue.js front end developer.
- 5+ years developing software solutions for internal business applications.
- Strong understanding of API development (REST).
- Excellent communication skills and collaborative mindset.

Nice-to-Haves
- Experience with Python, Django, PostgreSQL, or Prefect.
- Background in backend development to complement front end expertise.

jobs.title: C++ Frontend Engineer (JUCE / Audio UI)
jobs.about_us: Our client's mission is to push the boundaries of audio production through AI-enhanced software tools. Backed by a fast-growing global user base, we're now expanding our core team to support new product development and innovation.
jobs.job_description:
We are hiring three C++ Frontend Engineers to work on high-performance, professional-grade audio products. You will focus on building frontend interfaces in C++, with a strong emphasis on performance, user experience, and cross-platform delivery. You’ll work closely with our product and design teams to implement intuitive, visually compelling UIs that enable musicians, producers, and engineers to bring their ideas to life.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop and refine frontend interfaces for desktop audio applications and plugins
- Build performant, cross-platform UI components in C++
- Work within or adapt to frameworks such as JUCE or similar C++ GUI libraries
- Implement new features and iterate on existing ones in collaboration with product and QA teams
- Deliver well-documented, maintainable, and scalable code
jobs.job_requirements:
Required Qualifications:
- 3+ years of experience in C++ software development, with a focus on frontend/UI work
- Strong understanding of modern C++ and UI development best practices
- Ability to quickly adapt to new frameworks (e.g., JUCE or similar toolkits)
- Strong debugging and performance optimization skills
- Experience working in collaborative, remote engineering teams
- Proficient in English (enough for video calls and async team communication)

Nice to Have:
- Experience with JUCE framework or other C++ UI libraries used in audio software
- Familiarity with audio plugin architectures (VST, AU, AAX, etc.)
- Background in music production or use of digital audio tools
- Side projects or open-source contributions that demonstrate frontend or audio-related work
- Experience in startup or research-driven environment

jobs.title: Web Applications Developer (Singapore Position)
jobs.about_us: A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your Calling As a leading global manufacturer of heating, cooling, and water heating equipment, Rheem Manufacturing is continually innovating new ways to deliver just the right degree of environmental comfort to every home and business while saving energy, water, and supporting a more sustainable future. It is an exciting challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, we depend on talented individuals to power our innovations. Join our team and help shape the future of products that impact lives—every day.
jobs.job_description: The Web Applications Developer will be responsible for LAMP stack web development and maintenance across the enterprise’s wide array of public-facing websites and web applications. This position resides at the enterprise global technology level and supports initiatives across multiple company divisions around the world. This position will serve the Rheem Enterprise Division based out of Atlanta, Georgia. What You'll Do Write elegant, stable, efficient, and scalable code utilizing both internal and external development best practices. Combine data, best practices, and the latest technologies to continuously improve existing websites, libraries, and applications to keep Rheem at the leading edge of digital innovation. Participate in the development process from definition, through design, build, test, release, and maintenance. Develop game-changing WordPress plugins that span our entire line of brands, and revolutionize how Rheem interacts with and supports our customers and partners. Collaborate constantly with our frontend, backend, and mobile development teams to ensure that the entire Digital Services group is in-step, working together, and hitting goals as a team. Help drive the formulation of enterprise-wide digital design standards that will shape the future of Rheem web and mobile applications. Assist the e-commerce and front-end team on developing, refining, and executing short, medium, and long-term strategies that drive eyeballs, leads, and conversions to drive business growth.
jobs.job_requirements: What You'll Need Bi-lingual - English/Spanish required 3+ years of experience and intermediate technical skillset that spans PHP, Javascript, WordPress, Bootstrap, and Git, along with a burning desire to convert that skill level to an advanced degree. Solid understanding of front and backend architecture and security best practices. Sturdy understanding and experience with REST API integrations. Familiarity with AWS’ core web cloud services (S3, EC2, etc.). A Bachelor’s or higher degree in interaction design, human-computer interaction, cognitive science, computer science, or related field. How To Stand Out Experience with Jamstack, WordPress plugin development, WordPress Multisite, PHP, VueJS, React, Magento, Oracle Commerce Cloud, GraphQL, payment gateways, and/or other similar languages/frameworks/technologies. Development experience in an e-commerce environment. Walk us through the web project you’ve architected that you’re most proud of; if it’s out in the wild you get bonus points. Azure, QA, DevOps, Design, UI/UX, and/or Photoshop experience.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.about_us: We are hiring for one of our ecosystem projects and they are seeking a Frontend Engineer to join their team. We are looking for a skilled and dedicated Frontend Engineer with experience in developing, testing, and maintaining web applications. The ideal candidate will be proficient in both frontend/ backend technologies, have a keen eye for detail, and be able to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
jobs.job_description:
In This Role, You Will
- Develop and maintain high-quality web applications using React.
- Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend engineers to ensure seamless integration of frontend components.
- Continuously improve and optimize frontend performance and user experience.
- Perform all testing before release.
- Write and maintain unit tests and integration tests to ensure code stability and reliability.
jobs.job_requirements:
You Might Thrive In This Role If You Have
- 3+ years of experience in frontend development with a strong focus on React.
- Proficient in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, with a solid understanding of modern frontend build tools and frameworks.
- Knowledgeable in crypto, DeFi.
- Extensive experience in writing and maintaining unit tests and integration tests.
- Strong problem-solving skills and logical thinking, with the ability to quickly identify and resolve issues.
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
- Proficient in English is a must.

jobs.job_description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced Angular/UI Developer to join our team in Orlando, FL. This is a front-end focused role ideal for someone with 4–6 years of experience building scalable, enterprise-level applications using modern Angular frameworks. The ideal candidate will be passionate about user interface development and comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop and maintain responsive web applications using Angular 15+ (Angular 18 preferred)
- Implement state management using NgRx
- Integrate services and APIs to support dynamic content and functionality
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality user experiences
- Participate in code reviews and contribute to UI/UX improvements
jobs.job_requirements:
Required Qualifications:
- 4–6 years of professional experience in front-end development
- Strong proficiency in Angular 15+ (Angular 18 preferred)
- Experience with NgRx and service integrations
- Familiarity with enterprise-level application development
- Ability to work onsite one day per week (Wednesdays in Celebration, FL)

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience with Next.js
- Background in the hospitality or park industry (e.g., resorts, attractions, entertainment venues)
- Prior experience working with large-scale consumer-facing applications

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.job_description:
Your Responsibilities
Design, scope, and estimate complex frontend products/upgrades.
Envision and develop features to help grow PancakeSwap.
Enthusiastically collaborate with a small team to plan projects at the task level.
Collaborate with cross-functional partners on all aspects of product development.
Identify and advocate for team-wide areas of improvement and best practices.
jobs.job_requirements:
Skills & Qualifications
Solid experience with TypeScript, React.js, and Node.js.
5+ years of professional experience building responsive/adaptive web applications.
Strong ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code.
Experience with JavaScript testing frameworks.
Proficiency with modern frontend build pipelines and tools.
Experience architecting and delivering scalable frontend solutions.
Hands-on experience with Web3 and decentralized application frontends, including familiarity with modern Web3 libraries (e.g., viem, wagmi).
Exposure to GraphQL.

Key Traits
Eager to learn: Excited to dive into new tools and technologies.
Self-driven: Comfortable doing your own research and turning findings into practical solutions.
Fast learner: Able to quickly adapt to evolving requirements and environments.
Innovative mindset: Proactively looks for ways to improve products and workflows.

Good to have
Understanding of Solidity.
Familiarity with DEX protocols (not limited to PancakeSwap v2, v3, and Infinity).

jobs.title: Front-end Web Developer
jobs.location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
jobs.about_us: Do you love sharing unique stories through design and web development? Are you passionate about improving the user experience? Do you enjoy working with a dynamic team to develop a unique and compelling product? At Paradox, we believe when you get the people's things right you can build teams that can change the world. We’re a high performance culture with laser focus on building world class products and a team that our clients love. Our flagship product, Olivia, is the AI assistant helping companies around the world reimagine the way they hire: conversations instead of job applications, automated interview scheduling, and so much more. We’re looking for top performers who have a track record of success and want to build a company together as we continue our triple-digit growth and expand our global footprint.
jobs.job_description: We are looking for a talented Front-end Web Developer who shares our excitement for helping organizations recruit and hire through our best-in-class websites, built from scratch to showcase their unique career opportunities and share their stories. This is an exciting opportunity to roll up your sleeves and bring your web design, CSS/HTML, and Javascript skills to a large number of web-based design-build for a range of diverse clients and projects. You will be an integral member of the Product and Engineering team at Paradox, working collaboratively with product managers, engineers, and client-facing teams to build and ship bespoke websites for our clients. Sound like your perfect fit? We want to hear from you! As a Front-end Web Developer, You Will Evaluate, develop, and deliver based on design mocks and wireframes per clients’ needs and goals. Partner with our client success and design teams to bring to life the unique story and ethos of each client. Use your CSS/HTML expertise to execute design plans and build websites. Assist in the creation of new frameworks and components using HTML, CSS & JavaScript. Perform required maintenance, updates, and debugging of existing sites as directed by the design and product team. Approach each build with a balance of speed, attention to detail, and flexibility to the changing needs of the project and their team. Participate in the design, development, and support of technical projects from design to completion according to project standards and competing priorities.
job_requirements: 2 years of experience of hands-on front-end development building websites using Javascript, HTML, CSS, etc.
Experience with VueJS or Nuxt JS is an advantage.
Functional experience with storing, tracking, collaborating, and version control of code via GitHub.
Experience implementing responsive web design principles to ensure that client websites render well across multiple devices.
Experience with taking designs via Sketch, Adobe XD, or Figma (preferred) and independently building sites to specifications.
Excellent problem-solving skills with working through complex issues.
Able to build reusable codes for future use and share among front-end websites.
Possess an open mindset, embracing new ideas, perspectives, and approaches.
Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and managing various deadlines.
Portfolio or samples of previous website development work.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer-Mandarin speaker
jobs.about_us: MyShell is revolutionizing the AI landscape by building an open ecosystem for AI-native apps. Our powerful platform and intuitive toolkit empower anyone to create, access, and benefit from AI-powered applications. Launched in April 2023, MyShell has quickly gained global traction, attracting a diverse community of creators and users. Our team of talented individuals from top institutions like MIT, Princeton, and Oxford is committed to fostering innovation in a supportive and transparent work environment. With funding from leading VCs, MyShell is poised to reshape the future of AI, making it accessible and integral to everyone's daily life. Join us on this thrilling journey as we redefine what's possible with AI.
jobs.job_description:
Key Responsibilities
- Lead the development of sophisticated frontend applications, ensuring responsiveness and cross-platform compatibility.
- Architect scalable and maintainable web applications, adhering to high-quality code standards and best practices.
- Optimize applications for maximum speed and performance, delivering a seamless user experience.
- Collaborate with product managers, designers, and backend engineers to define APIs and integrate them seamlessly with UI components.
- Stay at the forefront of frontend technologies and best practices, incorporating them into our tech stack to drive innovation.
jobs.job_requirements:
Qualifications
- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
- 1-3 years of professional experience in frontend development, with a proven track record of building high-quality web applications.
- Deep expertise in React, HTML5, CSS3, and ES6+, with a strong understanding of modern frontend architectures and patterns.
- Proficiency in state management libraries and a solid grasp of RESTful APIs.
- Familiarity with build tools, version control systems (e.g., Git), and CI/CD processes.
- A strong portfolio showcasing your ability to create visually appealing and intuitive user interfaces.
- Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
- Fluency in Chinese (Mandarin).

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.about_us: Zenika was originally conceived by the idea of a developer; a consultant who is passionate about IT. Carl Azoury, founder and CEO of Zenika, wanted to create a consultancy aligned with his values where the consultant is at the heart of the company How ? By having time to train, work on open source projects or do research. By establishing both technical and commercial aspects closely. By being transparent about the rates or by really taking into account your expectations and your constraints on your next missions/projects. Our project: Coding the world 🌍 Since 2006, Zenika has been established as a real community of consultants who are experts in Open Source technologies, in the spirit of Craftsmanship. Anticipating changes is at the heart of our activities, where understanding the needs of tomorrow's ecosystem is done today. Technophiles at heart, our collaborations play a real role of expertise and advice for our clients As you can see, Zenika is a company created by techs, for techs! Zenika is also... 11 agencies for you to explore France… and the world! 🌍 28,000+ people trained around the world by Zenika, from which you can also benefit from! Make your choice on the ones you would like to follow 👉🏼 https://training.zenika.com/fr-fr/ 16 partners including Google Cloud, Elastic, Confluent, Scrum.Org and management 3.0! 🤝 Thousands of days allocated outside of missions, to keep you at the forefront of new technologies (conferences, articles, open source projects...) 😌 2 TechnoZaures per year to meet and share our skills 550 enthusiasts proud to wear the colors of Zenika wherever they go 🤩 Do you also want to join a company of enthusiasts? Come and share your experiences and future aspirations with the recruitment team, challenge your knowledge with one of our technical experts, and project yourself into your career at Zenika by meeting a manager! Join us in coding the world, and together, let's code your story!
jobs.job_description: As part of your daily toolkit, you keep an eye on Github, Stackoverflow, and Twitter. ⚒️ You are also mindful of the impact of IT on the environment and value green IT practices. 🌱 You enjoy learning from and sharing knowledge with your peers through internal events like TechnoZaure, NightClazz, and RemoteClazz 🎤 You don't take yourself too seriously and thrive in a fun and friendly environment 🎉 You regularly read top technical blogs, and you may even contribute to an open-source project. 😌 At Zenika, we consider the following to be essential for a skilled Front End Developer: You have a strong experience writing web apps using popular JS/TS frameworks and libraries (Angular, ReactJS, Vue.js, RxJS, Redux...). You are also skilled using front-end programming tools such as NPM, Webpack, Gulp, Grunt... You have a strong knowledge of the best UI coding practices (CSS in JS, styled components, custom hooks, state machines) and architecture patterns (MVC, MVVM, reducer patterns, Flux…). Write clean, efficient, and reusable code using modern JavaScript frameworks, libraries, and best practices. Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the delivery of high-quality, bug-free software. Familiarity with frontend testing frameworks and methodologies (e.g., Jest, Enzyme, Cypress). Understanding of responsive design principles and experience with building mobile-first and responsive web applications. As a Front End Developer with us, you may be assigned to: Play a key role in building our user-facing web applications, ensuring a smooth and intuitive user experience. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and backend engineers to deliver high-quality frontend solutions. Translate UI/UX designs and wireframes into functional, responsive, and pixel-perfect web pages. Collaborate with backend engineers to design and integrate APIs and ensure seamless data flow between the frontend and backend systems.
jobs.job_requirements: You have a strong experience writing web apps using popular JS/TS frameworks and libraries (Angular, ReactJS, Vue.js, RxJS, Redux...). You are also skilled using front-end programming tools such as NPM, Webpack, Gulp, Grunt... You have a strong knowledge of the best UI coding practices (CSS in JS, styled components, custom hooks, state machines) and architecture patterns (MVC, MVVM, reducer patterns, Flux…). Write clean, efficient, and reusable code using modern JavaScript frameworks, libraries, and best practices. Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the delivery of high-quality, bug-free software. Familiarity with frontend testing frameworks and methodologies (e.g., Jest, Enzyme, Cypress). Understanding of responsive design principles and experience with building mobile-first and responsive web applications.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer Graduate, Trust and Safety, TikTok - 2026 Start (BS/MS)
jobs.about_us:
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day. We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok Accommodation
TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://tinyurl.com/RA-request
jobs.job_description: The Trust and Safety (TnS) engineering team is responsible for protecting our users from harmful content and abusive behaviors. With the continuous efforts of our trust and safety engineering team, TikTok can provide the best user experience and bring joy to everyone in the world. Our team is responsible for achieving goals by building content moderation process systems, rule engines, strategy systems, feature engines, human moderation platforms, risk insight systems, and all kinds of supportive platforms across TnS organization. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team in 2026. As a graduate, you will get opportunities to pursue bold ideas, tackle complex challenges, and unlock limitless growth. Launch your career where inspiration is infinite at TikTok. Successful candidates must be able to commit to an onboarding date by end of year 2026. Please state your availability and graduation date clearly in your resume. Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as early as possible. Online Assessment Candidates who pass resume screening will be invited to participate in TikTok's technical online assessment. Responsibilities: Collaborate with cross-functional teams (XFN) including Product Managers, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Scientists, and QAs. Establish public trust by providing solutions to support risk and response business. Focus on escalation handling within the risk and response business.

minimum_qualifications: Currently pursuing an Undergraduate/Master in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline.
Ability to think critically and to formulate solutions to problems in a clear and concise way.
preferred_qualifications: Strong communication and excellent teamwork skills; being agile and a self-starter.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.about_us: Birdstop, Inc. is an American drone technology company. Made possible by its recent breakthroughs in regulatory approvals and AI systems, Birdstop drones can operate continuously in a fully automated mode without personnel onsite. Birdstop systems actively serve our nation's critical infrastructure and public safety organizations with rapid response capabilities.
jobs.job_description:
Role Birdstop’s Mission Control platform enables users to operate drones from thousands of miles away safely in National Airspace. As the first dedicated Front End Engineer on the team, your work will be the face of Birdstop’s technology to the customer. You will own the user experience for Birdstop’s Mission Control systems as well as various customer facing and regulator facing tools. You’ll collaborate closely with the product and engineering teams to create interfaces that are intuitive and highly reliable.

Responsibilities
- Build and maintain the applications that allow operators to control and monitor Birdstop’s fully automated drones in real time.
- Design, build, and maintain Birdstop’s customer-facing web applications.
- Develop front end applications in AngularJS to handle large volumes of real-time data.
- Implement clean, performant, and reusable UI components.
- Collaborate with design and product teams to deliver seamless UX.
- Ensure accessibility, responsiveness, and cross-platform compatibility.
- Optimize performance for real-time data visualization (maps, telemetry, video).
- Write automated tests and participate in code reviews.
- Contribute to the overall product roadmap and technical architecture.
- Work on features that display live, low-latency WebRTC video feeds and telemetry data from drones operating at remote sites.
- Work closely with operations teams to integrate feedback from real-world deployments into product improvements.
- Collaborate with design and product teams to make the interface intuitive, responsive, and easy to navigate in high-pressure situations.
jobs.job_requirements:
Basic Requirements
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
- 4+ years of professional experience in front end development.
- Proven experience with AngularJS in production environments.
- Hands-on experience with WebRTC and ultra-low-latency video streaming infrastructure.
- Hands-on experience building applications with real-time data (e.g., WebSockets, Pub/Sub, MQTT).
- Proficiency in deploying and managing scalable applications on Google Cloud Platform.
- Strong debugging, performance optimization, and problem-solving skills.
- Work authorization in the United States (no visa sponsorship available).
- Ability to work from Birdstop’s office in Detroit, Michigan.

Preferred Requirements
- Experience working with drones or airspace systems.
- Experience working with real-time data and video streaming applications.
- Understanding of network performance tuning and scaling strategies for high-traffic applications.

jobs.title: WebUI developer for LLM Data Training
jobs.about_us: Be part of a high-impact project where your frontend expertise helps train next-generation AI systems. As a WebUI Developer, you'll focus on generating polished, accessible, and production-ready UIs from natural language prompts—playing a key role in improving the visual and functional quality of AI-generated interfaces. This is a fully remote opportunity offering flexible hours, milestone-based structure, and competitive compensation based on quality and delivery. You'll work alongside a specialized team of engineers, designers, and QA experts committed to raising the bar for GenAI-driven user interfaces.
jobs.job_description:
Join SuperAnnotate AI to help train our GenAI-driven UI model. You’ll translate natural-language prompts into production-ready React/Next.js WebUIs, collaborating closely with our internal team. Your work will power cutting-edge AI workflows, ensuring that generated interfaces are functional, aesthetic, responsive, and accessible.

What You’ll Do
- Prompt-to-UI Generation: Craft and refine AI prompts per our Prompt Guidelines to drive v0.dev output.
- UI Implementation: Translate prompts into polished React/Next.js interfaces using Tailwind CSS, Shadcn/ui components, Lucide React icons, and Mermaid.js.
- Fine-Tuning: Post-process AI-generated code or hand-code adjustments for modularity, scalability, minimalism, and accessibility.
- Documentation: Author clear Intro, Chain of Thought, Project ID, Code as Markdown, and Outro sections, leveraging our Aurora Markdown Gen Python script.
- Testing & QA: Validate deliverables on desktop (Chrome, Firefox, Edge) and mobile (iOS Safari, Android Chrome) before submission.
- Feedback Mechanisms: Use sonner toast for in-app notifications (or Toast v1.2.4 when necessary).
- Secure Handling: Ensure all project assets and outputs are managed with best-practice security.
jobs.job_requirements:
Requirements
- Must have strong knowledge of JavaScript, React, and TypeScript.
- 5+ years building React/Next.js applications in TypeScript and Node.js.
- Skilled at crafting AI prompts and post-processing generated code.
- Comfortable modifying simple Python scripts for documentation automation.
- Proven ability to write clean, modular, and scalable frontend components.
- Expert proficiency in Tailwind CSS and Shadcn/ui component library.
- Strong familiarity with AI prompt engineering and GenAI-driven workflows on v0.dev.
- Demonstrated track record authoring technical documentation and step-by-step Chain of Thought narratives.
- Mobile-first testing discipline across Android and iOS browsers.
- Translate natural language prompts into functional, aesthetic, and responsive WebUIs.
- Prompt AI tools to build UIs using Next.js, React, Node.js, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui.
- Fine-tune the UI (using AI tools or coding) to make it production-ready in aesthetic, minimal, and accessible formats.
- Ensure clear layout, responsiveness, and component reusability.
- Experience using AI tools (like v0.dev, bolt.new) to build web apps.
- Self-motivated, deadline-oriented, and quality-obsessed.
- Excellent communication skills in a fast-paced, remote environment.
- English proficiency at B2, C1, C2, or Native level.

Nice to Have
- Prior experience with SuperAnnotate or similar data-annotation/AI training platforms.
- Prompt engineering or UI design background.
- Familiarity with Figma or design-to-code workflows.
- Experience with code review or QA processes.
- Strong documentation and feedback skills.

jobs.title: Junior Web Developer
jobs.about_us: Community Sports Partners is one of the largest and fastest-growing private youth sports operators in the GTA. We are dedicated to providing fun, engaging experiences that create lasting memories for the youth and families in our communities!
jobs.job_description: We are looking for a Junior Web Developer who is passionate about web design and development, with a primary focus on building high-converting landing pages and enhancing our website's front-end experience. This is an entry-level role ideal for candidates eager to gain experience in web development, particularly in UI/UX design and front-end technologies, with some exposure to back-end programming.
job_requirements: Design and develop visually appealing, responsive landing pages and website components
Optimize front-end designs for speed, SEO, and mobile responsiveness
Implement UI/UX best practices to improve user experience and engagement
Collaborate with the design and marketing teams to align website updates with brand goals
Make minor back-end updates to support landing page functionality (basic PHP and SQL)
Conduct A/B testing to analyze and improve user interactions
Debug and troubleshoot front-end issues to ensure smooth website performance
Stay up to date with the latest web design trends and technologies
skills: Basic Experience With Front-End Technologies: Html, Css, Javascript
Familiarity With Responsive Design And Mobile-First Development
Understanding Of Ui/Ux Principles And Basic Design Concepts
Basic Knowledge Of Back-End Technologies Such As Php And Sql (For Minor Updates)
Strong Problem-Solving Skills And Attention To Detail
Ability To Work Both Independently And Collaboratively In A Remote Environment

Familiarity With Responsive Design And Mobile-First Development
Understanding Of Ui/Ux Principles And Basic Design Concepts
